author: Will Louch
title: Abraaj Deals Upended Amid Dispute Over Health Fund
text:
Embattled Dubai-based private-equity firm Abraaj Group is struggling with recent major deals and has lost much of its senior management amid a fight with a group of prominent investors over spending in a $1 billion health-care fund.
Abraaj in March told the shareholders of Waco International, a South African construction firm with offices on three continents, that it couldn’t go through with a December deal to buy the company for an undisclosed amount because it didn’t have enough money, according to a Waco spokeswoman.
